summary: App authentication should be converted to pure username/password by fully removing all Internet Identity usage; current build attempts are failing and the app still behaves as if II is active.
architectural_notes: Authentication: fully remove Internet Identity (II) flow and dependencies; use only username/password login/signup across the app.
known_issues: Build/deploy attempt failed with 'AI was unable to implement your request' and user still sees the same message (II likely still active in background).

existing_features.title: Remove Internet Identity usage from the username/password sign-up flow so users can create an account without requiring `useInternetIdentity()` and without showing the error message “Please enable guest mode or sign in to continue”.

Replace Internet Identity-based “authenticated” checks in account/auth UI with backend-derived role/session state so the app never depends on `useInternetIdentity()` for gating pages or rendering “Sign In/Logout” states.
Ensure routing/navigation related to authentication uses only in-app pages (e.g., `/account/signup`, guest mode) and never links to or redirects to Internet Identity (id.ai).

new_feature_requests.summary: Remove all Internet Identity integration and make auth purely username/password (no useInternetIdentity dependency).
Update backend authorization so username/password sign-up can succeed without Internet Identity by allowing a guest caller to set credentials and be upgraded to a user role during sign-up.

projectName: Remove remaining Internet Identity dependencies and unblock username/password signup
